general.description:
Global executive. Eglantine is a versatile global executive. She has delivered complex projects and led teams in 20 different countries in Europe, the US and Asia-Pacific in consulting and manufacturing. 

In-house transformer. Eglantine is a catalyst for innovation and business transformation, She has a demonstrable track record in projects as diverse as a new operating model with supporting ERP systems implementation, transformation through technology, mergers and acquisitions and introduction of new ways of working (introduction of Agile, flexible working arrangements).

Strategist. Eglantine has expertise in co-designing business strategy with executive peers, transforming business objectives and challenges into an IT strategy through leadership, collaboration and influence, and enabling executive peers to leverage IT effectively. 

Inspiring leader. Eglantine takes leadership seriously. She is able to articulate a clear vision, and her strategic clarity and understanding of human nature equip her to lead and mobilise even teams struggling with change. She is strongly committed to inclusion and has built teams that balance gender, age and background diversity. 

Coach and mentor. Eglantine provides informal coaching to her peers on how technology contributes to business transformation, cultural change or operational efficiency through curated articles, conferences, organised sessions with thought leaders and individual conversations. 

Startup founder. In her spare time, Eglantine is building Boomerang Factory, a startup that helps employees develop new skills and competencies through designed experiential learning happening via internships in other organisations.

general.headline: CIO/CTO/Head of Technology Innovation/Director of Emerging Technologies & Chief Agitator
general.description:
A BIT ABOUT ME

I am a veteran CIO/CTO and business leader who, together with my team, have embarked upon one of the biggest technology enabled business transformations in the organisation’s 150 year history. By embracing a new wave of disruptive technologies we plan to transform the Building and Construction supply markets.

I led a major technology transition at CSR, where the application of world-leading technology and operational excellence is viewed by executive management & Board as a clear point of strategic differentiation.  As a result, CSR IT is delivering world-class digital platforms such as visualisers, external facing sites, CRM, B2B and B2C platforms; more agile IT infrastructure, and is innovating across its technology portfolio, from online self-service customer platforms, to mobile enabled enterprise applications at the construction site, through to developing an industrialised process for integrating M&A’s.  

I am an advocate of open systems, cloud computing and on-demand infrastructure, I am always looking at what opportunities and challenges lay ahead for the industry.  

I am fascinated by trends in social media, mobility and big data especially in the context of global, social and political issues. 

I believe in the generosity of the human spirit – and that as individuals we can make a difference on this planet.     

MY SKILL SET

TECHNOLOGY & BUSINESS STRATEGY - TRANSFORMATION & CHANGE LEADERSHIP – IT GOVERNANCE BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT – BUSINESS TURNAROUND – SAP ERP IMPLEMENTATION - PROCESS RE-ENGINEERING BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE & ANALYSIS - PMO ESTABLISHMENT & MANAGEMENT – VENDOR MANAGEMENT MARKET ANALYSIS - COMPLIANCE - FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT & COST CONTROL - TRANSITION TO HYBRID CLOUD - IOT & SENSOR TECHNOLOGY LINKED TO SUPPLY CHAIN PROCESS

jobs.jobTitle: Chief Technology Officer / Director of Emerging Technologies
jobs.description:
We are witnessing the ingredients of the perfect storm! 
Our customer base right across Australia and APAC is facing unprecedented cost pressure on managing operating expenses relating to energy, water and waste; coupled with the ongoing battle for improved customer experience through a contextualised & personalised digital engagement.    
We have reached a tipping point where disruptive technologies & the industrial internet is gaining steam at an exponential rate. Powered by next generation connectivity such as 5G & NB-IoT, embedded sensor technology, smart grid, deep ML and Mesh compute as a new wave of disruptive technologies fuelling a new wave of business innovation. 
As a member of the SingTel/Optus group, I am privileged to be part of an inspiring team - charged with building and commercialising intelligent digital infrastructure, separating hype from reality.

jobs.companyName: NSW Department of Family & Community Services – Business Services (Formerly NSW Businesslink)
jobs.description:
The NSW Government is transferring its disability services to the non-government sector by June 2018.  The transfer of disability services supports the transition to the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS), and will create a vibrant disability services market that will give people with disability greater choice.
I have responsibility to transition all of Clinical Support Services to The Benevolent Society. My remit has end-2-end responsibility across all functional streams – HR, Legal, Finance, Operations, IT, Change Management & Communications.

With a team of over 100 people (including contingent workforce), ~ 6 major technology partners & a complex reporting structure to the CFO, CEO/MD and Board, key responsibilities included the Governance of all Technology strategy projects & end-2-end responsibility for all IT Services across the CSR Group of companies.     

I conceived the vision, developed the strategy & plan to deliver an online customer self service portal digitising the customer "tradie" experience & thereby digitising the end-2-end customer supply chain. Viewed by Management & Board as pivotal in delivering against one of CSR’s key strategic planks, enabling the business to exploit disruptive technologies to increase the frequency & depth of engagement with the customer. 

I successfully delivered the technology workstreams of 2 major divestments: firstly, the Sucrogen & Energy Renewables business to a Singaporean conglomerate Wilmar, and secondly the APAC Insulation business to Rockwool International in Europe. Following the completion of both divestitures, I then embarked upon an IT enabled business transformation reaffirming CSR's market leadership position in the building and construction supply markets in the ANZ region. 

I delivered against a series of bolt-on acquisitions across Australia and New Zealand, close to core expansions integrating the newly acquired businesses with existing product lines. Most noteworthy was the Boral east coast bricks JV/Acquisition supporting CSR’s strategy for accelerated/profitable growth through targeted M&A

I partnered with the Chairman of CSR’s Risk and Audit Board to deliver CSR’s IT and Cyber security vision and plan, in sympathy with CSR's technology strategy transition to a mobile centric, hybrid-cloud IT model.

With a team of over 60 people across Asia Pacific region, ~ 6 major technology partners & a complex reporting structure to the local COO, CEO and APAC CIO.  Key responsibilities included the Governance of all technology strategy projects and hosting of mission critical business systems and regional IT infrastructure services.     

I developed a business case justification for streamlining the global supply chain process by integrating Alcatel’s regional SAP R/3 solutions across Europe and Asia Pacific. A major business driver for this project was to reduce equipment supply lead times by 40% in support of contractual obligations with key customers’ in Australia and New Zealand.   
	
I delivered the IT integration & consolidation plan in support of the merge between Alcatel and Lucent (ALU). Key elements of the business integration included the following technology enablers:

1. Migration of ALU’s opportunity pipeline and order forecasting into one global Siebel (CRM) solution 
2. Migration of ALU’s finance, project financial accounting, supply chain execution & sourcing into one SAP R/3 solution
3. Consolidation of Voice solutions including VOIP leveraging ALU technologies 

The above was delivered within a 12 month time horizon involving 15 countries across APAC. 

I conceived the vision and plan for establishing a Sydney based IT Data Centre with SAP R/3 as the core business system enabling a common business processing centre compromising of back office transactional finance, supply chain & other operational functions. This shared service capability was successfully adopted by 15 countries across the APAC region.

ASB is a joint venture company between Alcatel and Shanghai Bell and is currently Alcatel’s largest internal manufacturing facility worldwide.

During 2003/2004, I was seconded to the role as IT Director ASB to help deliver against a major business transformation. 

I was part of a team (business & IT) that successfully delivered on a major business model reconfiguration concerning the global supply chain, logistics execution & manufacturing business processes for ASB. This project brought about the following business improvements: 
1. 200% improvement in visibility over cost of goods sold                       
2. 100% uptake in business adoption of process improvements within SAP R/3, enabling business data such as customer orders & forecasts to drive production planning
3. Upgrade of SAP Software to introduce system stability

general.description:
A leading strategist, futurist and digital technologist who anticipates how market forces and emerging technology trends can impact organisational design, business models and the workforce of the future.  A passionate innovator and disruptive thinker with an ability to deliver new products and eco-systems to transform organisations into digital businesses.  Her ability to co-innovate, collaborate and re-imagine industries makes her a trusted advisor to many at all levels globally.  She is a passionate advocate for Human-Centred Design, agility, Lean, STEAM and contributing to the thought leadership for the future of the workforce.

Claire brings more than 30 years of digital/technology/business transformation experience.  She has advised and held executive leadership roles in iconic companies across a range of industries (Finance, Telco, Retail, Insurance and Airlines) geographies (AsiaPac, EMEA and the US) such as AirNZ, British Telecom, National Broadband Network (next gen broadband for Australia), Woolworths, Fidelity, Commerzbank, BNP Paribas, Lloyds Bank, Insurance Australia Group (IAG) and Coles.  

Claire is passionate about sustainability, diversity, inclusion and genuinely wants to make the world a better place.  The new norms of business and digital not only mandate increased levels of digital maturity in enterprise businesses but also commitments to purpose.  Claire understands the perspectives and challenges of C-suite and board leaders leaning in to the 4th industrial revolution. 

Technology when used for good can change the world.

general.headline: Chief Technology Officer at Melbourne Water
general.description:
I am the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) of the Victorian State Government owned Melbourne Water. In my 25 year career as an accomplished Senior Executive, I have delivered tangible contributions to organisations through technology transformation to support business strategy and growth. 

Core to my success has been my ability to create a shared technology vision, delivered through the development and leadership of high performing teams. 

I am a member of the Australian Computer Society's Professional Education Governance Committee and am passionate about rectifying the gender diversity imbalance in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathemetics (STEM). I am a former member of the Financial Service Council’s Infrastructure Committee. I chaired the swimEC (superannuation, wealth and investment management Electronic Commerce) Sub-Committee which launched the swimEC standards, the precursor to new SuperStream standards (https://www.ato.gov.au/super/superstream). I maintain an active interest in the not-for-profit sector.

I speak by invitation nationally in the areas of eCommerce, Technology Transformation and IT Leadership.

I hold a Masters in Business Administration [MBA Executive] from the Australian Graduate School of Management (AGSM), I am Graduate of the Australian Institute of Company Directors, past Associate Fellow of the Australian Institute of Management and a member of the AGSM Alumni. 

Specialties: Strategic Planning, IT Operations, Start-ups & SME’s, Risk & Compliance, Stakeholder Management, Program/Project Management, Software Development, Financial Management, High-Performing Teams

jobs.jobTitle: Various IT roles to Program Director
jobs.description:
NAB rationalised its IT divisions in Australia, New Zealand and Asia into a single services organisation known as Asia-Pacific Integration (API). As a Programme Director, my responsibilities were to establish and lead two of the programmes required to achieve this integration. In these roles, I achieved the following:

•	development and approval of programme Business Cases. 
•	establishment of Steering Committees with relevant IT and business representation. 
•	establishment of the projects required to achieve the integration. 
The Channel Services programme decoupled core business applications from the channels that delivered their functionality (e.g., Internet, branch, EFTPOS). A message-based architecture enabled the delivery of business functions across multiple channels without ‘re-inventing the wheel’ as new channels were introduced. Once the programme was underway, but prior to its completion, I moved to establish the HR programme.

jobs.description:
As General Manager of Automotive Aftermarket for Bosch Oceania I have responsibility for supply, logistics, sales and marketing of automotive spare parts across Australia and New Zealand.  Servicing more than 200 customers across 14 product categories / 30,000 SKUs to more than 1,300 delivery points.

Beyond spare parts the Bosch team also sell workshop test equipment, training and aftersales services to all automotive repair shops. In addition we manage (franchise model) the Bosch Service Network in Oceania, with over 350 car repair locations covering car service, diesel service and Auto electrical specialists. Our services customer base has 1000+ customers across brand concepts, training and software offers.

The GM Commercial had accountability for bulk fuel and lubricants sales servicing a broad range of customers throughout Australia, delivering approximately 5 billion litres per annum  of fuel (approx $6b in revenue), literally “fuelling” Australian business.  The division was split into 3 sectors; Industrial, Branded Wholesale & Liberty. 

The Industrial team looked after mining and other resource sector customers including the provision of technical services. The mining sector was dominated by large tenders for supply of product and technical services for 3-5 year periods requiring sophisticated bid management, extensive negotiations and key account management over the life of the contract. Viva Energy held a high market share in this sector, operating complex supply chains for Australia's top mining companies with need for continuous improvement in the areas of cost efficiencies, safety and innovation.  

The Branded Wholesale team looked after both wholesalers and 200+ 3rd party Shell branded service stations. Wholesalers purchased on both term and spot contracts ex refinery / terminal gate with most customers holding contracts with multiple suppliers requiring a constant focus on being competitive, whilst monitoring credit viability. Under license from Shell Viva Energy managed the relationship with over 200 single site service station owners who contracted to Viva Energy for the right to be branded Shell. These contracts provided use of the Shell brand whilst requiring the service station to meet certain standards and also purchase 100% of their fuel needs from Viva Energy. In addition this division also took on the responsibility for establishing a new model of Shell branded commission agent service stations. 

The Liberty team looked after the relationship with Liberty Australia, a major Wholesaler and Retail nationally. Viva Energy is a shareholder and a supplier to Liberty who also manage a number of Shell branded service stations.

general.headline: WE DREAM BIG
general.description:
Melissa is a proud sole parent to Isabella, Lili & Jett. Lili was diagnosed with a rare brain disorder as well as long list of many other diagnosis. It is this experience that changed the way she saw the world & the driving force to make it better.

Melissa is a strong advocate for children with disabilities speaks regularly to Community groups, TAFE Classes & Organisations.
She is a Interchange Board Member, A Management Committee Member for both NSW Family Advocacy & Shellharbour Council Access committee. 
A Passion for creating Inclusive communities has been working on creating more Accessible Beaches around Australia, with the first in the Illawarra not far off fruition.
Melissa has spoken at the World Forum in Melbourne on Social Inclusion for people with a disability, the Australasian Intellectual Council Conference as well as ‘Transition to School’ workshops, ‘Living with a disability’ playgroup and other community initiatives. Others include the SCAN Early Childhood Conference & the Aged Care & Disability Conference "Elephant in the Room"​ 
Melissa has spoken at Senate Enquiries as well as Panels on how to better support not only individuals living with a Disability but also on how to better support Families.
Melissa was runner up in Nova's International Short Film competition in 2011
She along with her daughter Lili have both roles behind the camera and in front of the camera with an Inclusive Film Project. This project has upscaled since to also a sensory film exhibition that has successfully ran at the Merringong Theatre.
She recently co-presented the International ISBA Respite Conference in Edinburgh Scotland last year & two workshops at the National Future Schools Expo in Melbourne March 2017. 
She will be speaking at the upcoming International Carer's Conference being held in Adelaide this October.
Melissa was awarded ‘Carer of the Year ‘in 2012 and again most recently 2015 for her local area & was nominated for 'Australian of the Year’ in 2013.

I have proven experience in business development, relationship management, bidding, candidate management and providing end to end recruitment solutions within public and private services in the UK and Australia.

I am passionate about Healthcare, Community Services and Not for Profit causes and strive to ensure the needs of the population are met through my partnering of community health services, humanitarian and environmental organisations and ensuring they having the most proficient and talented workforce and leadership.

I also manage large recruitment projects for the NDIS Transition sourcing health professionals to deliver transition and service provision.

NGO Recruitment provides a full recruitment service that includes advertised selection and search. We believe our specialised experience within the not-for-profit sector makes all the difference when selecting the right person for your organisation.

general.headline: Currently looking for a senior leadership NFP gig
general.description:
Leadership in change management, as well as developing and interpreting policy in the disability service sector, is what I'm good at.

With more than a quarter of a century of operational experience gained from working in services that support people with disability, I was then privileged to lead a team of more than 50 dedicated professionals in representing and supporting all 590 disability service providers in NSW for 3 years, as State Manager of National Disability Services (NDS) during the formative years of the NDIS.

Excellent service and great support from someone who knows.

Phone: 0412 020 478
Email: scott@peregrinus.com.au
Web: www.peregrinus.com.au
Twitter: @scottrholz

jobs.description:
As the Principal Consultant at Peregrinus, I bring over 30 years of experience to what is required for NDIS transition gained from working in disability services for more than a quarter of a century; and an intimate knowledge of the policy framework, having also been the NSW State Manager of the industry peak body, National Disability Services (NDS) during the formative years of the NDIS. 

Services delivered include:

•	NDIS transition planning
•	Strategic planning
•	Business planning
•	Workshop facilitation
•	NDIS education

Major customers include:

•	Australian Unity (supporting the takeover of the Home Care Service of NSW)
•	The Benevolent Society (supporting the takeover of all FaCS NSW clinical services)
•	PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC – as NDIS subject matter expert)
•	Qld Dept. of Communities, Child Safety and Disability Services
•	The Flagstaff Group
•	Uniting Disability
•	New Horizons Enterprises
•	Wesley Mission
•	Catholic Healthcare
•	Ngunnawal Aboriginal Corporation

Together we can make it.

Phone: 0412 020 478
Email: scott@peregrinus.com.au
Web: www.peregrinus.com.au

One strong voice - National Disability Services (NDS) is the Australian peak body for disability services.

The role of the team I led, was to work with government to develop good policy; as well as provide supports to build the capacity of the NFP NGO sector for growth and to prepare for new ways of conducting business under the NDIS.

Within NDS in NSW, I led the delivery of upwards of 35 separate, yet complementary projects to support the sector. Focus areas included strengthening organisational governance, business development, workforce recruitment and development, quality framework development, implementing person centred approaches, building aboriginal resources and pathways, improving safety, and facilitating government procurement from Australian Disability Enterprises.

Sector engagement and communication was a key component of my role. To keep the sector informed and to seek feedback from disability service providers on the issues affecting them, I also oversaw more than 80 scheduled conferences and forums per year. 

NDS in NSW also managed the Companion Card program on behalf of the NSW State Government. Companion Card enables improved access for people with disability to venues by allowing the person to be accompanied by a carer for the price of a single admission.

As CEO, I was responsible for the overall service leadership of lifestyle and employment support to over 450 adult people with disability; and employed some 350 staff inclusive of 100 supported employees. 

Services included Supported Accommodation, Independent Living, Day Options, Respite, Attendant Care, and Australian Disability Enterprises.

The main focus of my role was the introduction of modern management practices including cost centre accounting and quality management.

Several titles in my time at DSA, but always as a member of the Executive Management Team as we grew from 27 staff to over 400. 

By the time I left, I was leading all of DSA's Disability Employment Services, Australian Disability Enterprises, Transition to Work, Registered Training Organisation (specialising in Children's Services and Disability Work training), Service Access, and Stakeholder Relations (Marketing and Fundraising). 

DSA introduced me to the business world where amongst other things, I was responsible for leading a team that got 10 million pieces of cutlery onto international flights every year. 

DSA also allowed me to explore my inventiveness, including being given the task of establishing one of the first open employment services for people with psychiatric disability in Australia; and generally bring a whole range of new ways of delivering service into being across a number of program areas. 

I loved it!

Worked as a Vocational Trainer till December 1991. I was then tasked to establish and lead Jobsupport's expansion into the South-West of Sydney.  

Jobsupport was, and probably always will be, all about placing and keeping people with moderate levels of intellectual disability into the regular labour market. No Disability Employment Service does it better!

jobs.jobTitle: Coordinator (Programme Designer) Natani Activity Training Centre
jobs.description:
Worked as a part-time Programme Implementer for several months then took on the full-time in-charge role.

It was a really satisfying place to work where we were able set up a new centre to introduce people with severe and profound levels of disability into the community after living a life of segregation in institutions.

What can I say? I wanted a job that took me up in the world. I worked on several
      high-rise construction sites and building refurbishments in the Sydney CBD, North
      
      Shore and the Ryde area.

Initially I was employed to establish and lead a 'demonstration project' mobile work crew till November 1986. I then became the inaugural Industries Training Officer (a role I envisaged and sold to the CEO) till March 1987. My final role was leading their workshop operating as a mailing house and employing around 110 people with disability.

I commenced right alongside the implementation of the Commonwealth Disability Services Act and this was the gig that got me hooked on my career in the disability sector. I always reflect upon my time there fondly.

Integrated into a regular MP company, the work consisted of a mix of garrison policing

A professional social worker with experience in mental health recovery-oriented services since 2009.

Following are activities undertaken as a private citizen and are not related to present employment  role:   

--mental health advocate committed to increasing awareness of recovery to assist individuals with mental health with experience in local, national and international mental health initiatives; personal story of experiencing mental illness and recovery in the public domain, including Senate Select Committee on Mental Health (Commonwealth of Australia-Hansard, 27 July 2005), The Canberra Times (Cronin, D., 27 November 2010) and the Australian Broadcasting Corporation (7.30 ACT, Kimball, C., 2 August 2013).

--author of 'Changing My Mind', a chapter in 'Coming Out Proud to Erase the Stigma of Mental Illness' (Corrigan, P.W., Larson, J.E. and Michaels, P.J., 2015); a book described by former U.S. First Lady Rosalynn Carter as "a seminal work that confronts stigma head on and replaces it with acceptance and inclusion."   

--social activist addressing the regulatory capture of the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC) and challenging a highly unorthodox wealth redistribution scheme; a personal campaign that has so far resulted in questions in Canada's House of Commons in 1995 and 2008 (www.onemedialaw.com).

--designated as a public interest litigant by Justice Sharpe (Ontario Court, General Division) in Mahar v. Rogers Cablesystems Ltd., a precedent-setting legal case against a multi-billion-dollar corporation which continues to influence costs decisions in public interest cases internationally.  

--corporate broadcasting industry insider in Canada from 1987 to 1994; employed for specialist knowledge of the cable television industry and its regulation by the CRTC.

I have held a number of roles that have been unique such as setting up and running an organisation in Australia for a UK charity and a not for profit Australian organisation, meeting the needs of the disadvantaged, winning a substantial amount of new business for a leading health provider. Before this I was the Human Resource Development Manager of a leading UK charity and before that I was fortunate to be involved in several unique projects in Japan.

Currently I am a member of the Senate of the University of Queensland, Chair of Australian Regional and Remote Community Services, a non-executive Director of Opera Queensland, member of the AICD Queensland State Council and a member of the Community Director's Council.

My last CEO role was at UnitingCare Queensland, a health, aged care and community service provider with over 25,000 staff and volunteers and an annual budget of $1.6Bn, a large capital program and more than 400 sites.

I was named Telstra 2014 Australian Business Woman of the Year, awarded a University of Queensland Alumni Excellence Award in 2016, was named one of Queensland's Leading Women by YMCA.

In 2018 I was admitted as a Member of the Order of Australia for my service to the Community through Government and non-government sectors and to women. 

I am a Fellow of the Australian Institute of Company Directors and a member of Chief Executive Women.

As the health and community service provider of the Uniting Church UnitingCare has supported Queensland communities for over 100 years. 17 000 staff and 9 000 volunteers care for and support people from all walks of life, including older people, people with a disability, children, families and Indigenous people .

general.headline: President at University of Queensland Union | UQU
general.description:
Every person, company or organization has a story to tell, an idea to chase, or a course to follow. Succeeding in these endeavors takes the right type of talent to consistently add value, surprise, delight and have a positive impact on the bigger picture. 

As both a contractor and employee, my goal has always been the same. To find a workplace that engages me to excel and adapt my skills to fit those ideals and objectives. 

Currently, I am self-supporting my studies towards a Dual Bachelor of Engineering and Economics at UQ working as a customer advisor for Telstra Retail. Filling in the rest of my schedule with involvement with Clubs and Societies at the University of Queensland

My specialties include electrical and software engineering design, organizational leadership, sales experience, social media management and creative design. 

Get in contact with me at jeremylwinmedia@gmail.com

jobs.description:
The UQ Union is a student-run organisation that represents over 50,000 students at the University of Queensland. UQU is responsible for delivering both commercial and student services and employing over 250 staff and has an annual turnover of 20M+. 

The key responsibilities of the president are; management of the student executive team, management and oversight of senior UQU staff, stakeholder engagement between UQ and UQU, and representation of students within the high-level governance structures of the University.

Boards and Committees; UQ Senate (Observer), UQ Finance Committee, UQ Academic Board, UQ Student Experience Committee, UQ Senate Student Appeals Committee.

Over the past 9 months my key achievements include; the negotiation of a 6 year funding agreement between UQ and UQU which increases total university funding by 15%, securing a commitment to construct a new 15M bar, functions and events centre on campus, a complete restructure of the UQU to address cultural issues and drive closer working relationships between staff and student representatives.

general.headline: Partner at Gadens
general.description:
John is a Partner in Gadens Brisbane's Property and Commercial Services Group.  Having developed key legal expertise in property and commercial transactions acting for major Australian property industry clients over the past decade, John specialises in shopping centre development and retail leasing. He acts for some of Australia's largest retail shopping centre landlords.

John’s practice includes shopping centre acquisitions and disposals in Queensland; all lease dealings (including disputes) with major, mini-major and specialty shop tenants for shopping centres in Queensland and New South Wales; and a specialisation in shopping centre developments.

John and his team recently advised on the $670million redevelopment of Pacific Fair Shopping Centre, the $150million redevelopment of Orion, Springfield Central, the $550million redevelopment of Indooroopilly Shopping Centre and the $440million redevelopment of Macquarie Centre. 

Recognised as an industry expert, John has chaired and presented at numerous conferences and often consults on regulatory and industry issues.  John is a member of the Property Council of Australia Queensland Retail Committee and advised the Shopping Centre Council of Australia on the recent review of the Queensland Retail Shop Leases Act.

general.headline: Partner at Holding Redlich
general.description:
I have had more than 20 years' experience acting for an range of public and private sector organisations on IT projects, especially software licensing, implementation and support, cloud services and privacy and data advice. 

I also assist clients in the startup ecosystem, providing initial advice on structuring, IP protection, fund raising and funding agreements, NDAs and employment arrangements, regulatory issues and services agreements. 

I am highly regarded for the commercial and pragmatic advice I provide, with a specific focus on strategic procurement and the development, negotiation and implementation of complex contracts.  

I regularly advise local and international clients on privacy compliance issues, as well as a broad range of issues relating to data – including value capture, management, security and breaches.

I also advise clients on software licensing and support contracts, ICT services, cloud computing and privacy and data security and offer clients a wealth of expertise and a strong commercial focus on all aspects of ICT projects. 

I am very experienced in government contracting, having advised on the development of the Queensland Information Technology Contracting (QITC) Framework in Queensland and the equivalent framework in New South Wales (Procure IT).

My clients include Brisbane Airport Corporation, the University of Queensland, Racing Queensland, Red Bull, Suncorp, TAFE Queensland and the Queensland State Government.

jobs.description:
Day to day I offer general IT advice, manage contracts, advise on privacy compliance, agreements and privacy policy, data retention review & policies, regulatory compliance advice, software licensing and support agreements, cloud services & SaaS agreements and general IT services agreements.

As part of the procurement process, I advise on each stage of the processes, prepare EOI & RFT documents and evaluate responses for EOI and RFT.

I have a strong knowledge of technology so I understand the products & services which can be used in contracts and negotiations, enabling me to offer pragmatic advice based on circumstances and business position.

I assist clients with startup projects, offering initial consultations to make them aware of key legal issues to consider, preparation of key documents such as confidentiality agreements, and regular meetings as the business evolves. I also assist startups in the transition from local Australian operations to key overseas target areas in the United States and Europe.

I conduct training sessions & workshops for clients on negotiating IT contracts, Cloud Computing, data security, negotiating software contracts, unfair contract terms.

If you would like to discuss any issues relating to IT and technology or procurement, contact me to arrange a time to provide initial consultation & advice.

In this role I mainly worked with QLD, NSW & NT Government, local councils, large scale ERP implementation projects (finance, payroll systems) and transport (tolling systems projects).  This was typically transactional however included some larger projects providing advice on privacy compliance, agreements in privacy policy, data retention review & policies.

As part of the procurement process I advised on stages of the processes, prepare EOI & RFT documents, evaluation of responses for EOI and RFT. 

I offered regulatory compliance advice and handled software licensing and support agreements, cloud services & SaaS agreements, general IT services agreements.

general.headline: Senior Associate at Mullins
general.description: Corina is a Solicitor and Registered Migration Agent (MARN 1281043), admitted to practice as a Solicitor of the Supreme Court of Queensland and the High Court of Australia.  Corina is a Senior Associate at Mullins and expert in Australian immigration law. Corina completed her Practice Management Course in 2016 and is seeking to become an Accredited Immigration Law Specialist through Queensland Law Society's next program intake.  Corina is dedicated in her practise as an immigration law professional, and seeks to provide the best migration solutions to her clients in the most efficient and cost-effective manner.

jobs.description:
Experience – Solicitor and Registered Migration Agent (MARN 1281043):

Corina is a Senior Associate at Mullins and expert in Australian immigration law.  She has an exceptional record in assisting clients to secure residency in Australia across a full range of visas, with particular experience in handling high-volume transactions and complex matters.

Corina assists a wide range of clients, from large scale companies to SMEs and private individuals.  

Indeed, Corina has a passionate commitment to her clients and takes pride in providing migration services of the highest quality and effectively identifying the best solution for resolving a matter in the most efficient and commercial matter.

Corina is highly organised with exceptional interpersonal skills, and her strong technical knowledge of Australian immigration law allows her to deliver advice with confidence.  Corina’s experience also allows her to identify novel visa solutions and develop strategies for complicated migrant circumstances.

Corina is dedicated to her work, and is committed to delivering successful outcomes and providing the best immigration law services to her clients.

Experience – Solicitor & Registered Migration Agent (MARN 1281043):  

Corina has a passionate background in migration law, gained in her years of working with migrant and refugee communities as a highly sought-after professional.  

Corina has extensive experience in handling complex migration matters and making submissions to the Department in seeking various waivers and exemptions. Her experience includes preparing quality advice and submissions for, and incl.: health and character issues; comprehensive and auditable business and training  plans; the English requirement; preclusion periods (or 3 year re-entry bans); waiver of the 'No Further Stay'​ condition; advising substantial criminal  history  applicants; and assisting clients without a visa in regularising their visa status.

Corina has an exceptional record in assisting clients secure residency and citizenship in Australia, and she is experienced across a full range of visas with particular focus on working with large scale companies and clients seeking Work and Skilled Visas. Corina understands that not everyone has an easy pathway to migrate to Australia, and her experience allows her to devise complex strategies and assist clients in finding novel visa solutions. Her experience includes short-stay visas, independent migration, student pathways, specialist entry visas, partner and family (child or parent) migration. She also assists clients with merits and judicial review applications, including Requests for Ministerial Intervention.

Corina is committed to providing clients with the best professional service to identify the right visa solution, and effectively assist them in securing their stay in Australia with maximum prospects of success.

***

• Solicitor: Sep 2011 - Nov 2012
• Associate, Solicitor: Nov 2012 - Dec 2012

jobs.description:
Established in 2010, we have brought together some of the industry's most experienced, proactive and dedicated recruitment executives servicing all levels across our areas of expertise. Currently with over 150 Consultants and 11 offices in Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, China, Hong Kong, UK, and Dublin, our goal is to offer a global service with a boutique approach.

Our specialisations within the partnership are presently Stirling Andersen – Insurance & Wealth; Walker Andersen - Accounting & Finance; and Baker Andersen - Property & Construction. All brands work cohesively, servicing our key accounts across specialisms, state and international borders; therefore understanding our clients’ needs from a local and global level.

We are experienced in providing contingent, executive and high volume recruitment strategies and we tend to specialise in what are perceived to be 'hard to fill" roles.

Although we have a strong advertising presence, in both traditional and social media formats; we focus on generating candidates through a referral and networking approach that taps into the "passive" market.

We pro-actively host; industry focused, networking and educational forums or seminars, often in conjunction with industry bodies and clients.

If you're a Client, we tailor our approach to service your needs and requirements, and not a one size fits all solution.

If you’re a Candidate, we listen to your career goals and assist you in making the next step, the right move.

Midas Selection is an established and accredited recruitment consultancy that specialises in Sales, Marketing and Executive appointments across the UK and Europe.

Aligned to specific sectors of Business and Industry, in my case the Energy Sector, we understand and appreciate market complexities. 

We manage accounts on a countrywide basis, we do not demarcate geographically. This proves highly effective for senior management teams and HR departments to be able to partner with just one trusted and visible key account manager.

We retain control throughout the whole recruitment cycle, therefore providing a seamless 360 degree account management approach, our customers tell us that they benefit from one contact, one consistent advisor and one service level.

general.headline: Partner at Hogan Lovells
general.description:
Ian is an energy and resources lawyer with broad corporate transactional and regulatory capabilities who is recognised as a leading energy and resources lawyer in Australia. 

Ian brings nearly two decades of experience acting in the energy and resources sectors in Australia and internationally, advising clients on both the transactional and regulatory aspects of deals.

Ian has worked on a large number of the most significant offshore and onshore LNG/oil and gas projects in Australia and on asset acquisition and other transactions in Southeast and Central Asia, Europe and New Zealand. He has a strong energy regulatory practice and advises on all aspects of Australian offshore and onshore petroleum laws and regulations including registrations of transfers and dealings and governmental agreements. 

Ian has also advised on a large number of cross-border mining project interest acquisitions in Australia, Europe, Asia and Africa as well as on mining and procurement activities for Australian operators. He advises on all aspects of Australia mining laws and regulations. 

Prior to joining Hogan Lovells, Ian was a special counsel in the PR&E group at King & Wood Mallesons. Before that, he was a partner in the Energy, Mining and Infrastructure Group of the Tokyo office of a large US firm. Ian has also worked for the Metal Mining Agency of Japan (now JOGMEC) and has been seconded to a large Japanese trading house, a large Chinese oil & gas company and an iron ore project company, usually as senior counsel. 

Ian graduated with a double degree in Law and Asian Studies from The Australian National University and a graduate diploma in Energy and Resources Law from Melbourne University. Ian is fluent in Japanese. 

Ian is a member of the Australian Mining and Petroleum Law Association (AMPLA) and the Association of International Petroleum Negotiations (AIPN).  

Ian was admitted to practice in June 2000.

general.headline: Judge's Associate  at Supreme Court of Western Australia
general.description:
I completed a Bachelor of Law with First Class Honours at Murdoch University, graduating in February 2017. For the Honours Program I examined three areas of law that hold special interest for me: health care, privacy and policy. My more narrowly defined thesis explored the the application of the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth) to the medical use of digital imagery with specific reference to contemporary dermatology and primary care practice. My thesis identified the emerging differences between the legislation and the practices surrounding the rapid adoption of digital technology in Australian health care.

Law school has been both exciting and challenging. Coming from a more structured retail banking background, I had to overcome my reticence to present my ideas publicly. I successfully competed in Murdoch’s Trial Advocacy Competition, joined the Moot Court Bench, and presented the case for a refugee immigration visa case through Murdoch’s SCALES pro bono service. 

One of the greatest satisfactions of a recently completed clerkship was that my training and tenacity enabled me to provide research product sufficiently thorough to be used by my supervisors when advising the client and preparing court briefs / submissions. For me, no exam result could match this simple marker of skills acquired. 

I am currently a Judge's Associate at the Supreme Court of Western Australia.

general.headline: Lawyer turned funtrepreneur // Co-founder Matcha Maiden // Co-founder Matcha Mylkbar
general.description: Sarah started her working life as a mergers and acquisitions lawyer at a leading international law firm. While law was a wonderful launching pad affording her several years of invaluable learning and development both in Australia and overseas, it became increasingly difficult for her to balance the demanding professional lifestyle with her more creative and adventurous impulses. When she and her partner Nicholas started a small health food business, Matcha Maiden, as a humble side project Sarah discovered her passion in fact lies where she can flex her creative muscles, indulge her love for human interaction and work from new and exciting places everyday. Fortunately, the pair had stumbled across a sizeable gap in the domestic and international markets and found themselves running a booming global business in a matter of months, allowing Sarah to hang up the suits and heels to step into the business full-time as a blossoming "funtrepreneur".

jobs.description:
Matcha Mylkbar is Australia's first specialty matcha cafe showcasing this vibrant green superfood as well as a world leading, innovative plant-based breakfast and lunch menu. There are five "Blue Zones" in the world where people live longer than anywhere else and the primary factor they share in common is a majority plant-based diet - not because of any moral/ethical/political concerns but simply due to what is sustainable. Okinawa, Japan is one of the five zones and has the highest number of centenarians in the world, largely due to a plant-based diet and high levels of matcha consumption. Matcha Mylkbar's menu is built around this research and a philosophy of putting the sustainability and longevity benefits of plant based eating at the Melbourne cafe culture's disposal in a way that takes the moral/political/ethical elements and stigma away from vegan dining. 

Each dish is designed to please all palates, preferences and dietary requirements. We have even developed a "vegan egg" made wholly of plant based materials but with the same consistency and texture of a regular egg. This is culinary innovation as you've never seen it before! The beverages are equally as progressive featuring Melbourne's first beetroot and mushroom lattes and, of course, a host of matcha themed drinks. The menu can be found online at www.matchamylkbar.com

Matcha powder has been around for centuries and was originally consumed by Zen Buddhist monks in their meditative practices. In its ceremonial form, it is prepared using a bamboo whisk with hot water as part of the traditional Japanese tea ceremony ritual. Until recently, it was perceived as a special occasion indulgence and wasn't widely recognised beyond the tea realm nor was it affordable or accessible to the masses. That was, of course, until the birth of Matcha Maiden in late November 2014.

Sarah and her partner, Nic, were surprised to find this vibrant green powder had not yet taken off in the health food world. It sounds complicated and fancy, but it’s actually quite simple – matcha is purely green tea leaves ground into powdered form. Because it is so concentrated, you can get up to 137 x the antioxidants of regular green tea per serve and up to 10 x the overall nutritional content. Its powdered form also lends it to uses far more creative than a plain tea, so Nic and Sarah set out to change the world's perception of matcha powder shifting it from a "ceremonial tea" to a "daily use superfood". Just over a year later, Matcha Maiden has warehouses both in Australia and the US, over 1000+ physical stockists around the world, almost 100,000 followers, a team of staff and interns and a soon-to-open physical matcha specialty cafe.

general.headline: Partner at Clayton Utz
general.description:
Brendan Groves specialises in corporate law, advising both listed and unlisted corporate clients on major corporate transactions and general corporate law and regulatory issues.  He has extensive experience in equity capital markets transactions, acting for issuers, underwriters and other stakeholders in floats, rights issues and placements, including an eight-month secondment in 2007 as general counsel to the equity capital markets group of a leading investment bank. He also has significant experience in mergers and acquisitions, acting for both bidders and targets on a range of public and private/negotiated M&A transactions. 

IFLR1000 ranks Brendan as one of Australia's leading Equity Capital Markets lawyers (2010 - 2013).  Chambers & Partners ranks Brendan as one of Australia's leading Equity Capital Markets lawyers (2011 - 2012).

Profile link - http://www.claytonutz.com.au/people/groves_brendan/home.page

general.headline: Director of Legal Practice at Consumer Action Law Centre
general.description:
Amanda Storey is the Director of Legal Practice of the Consumer Action Law Centre a Victorian community legal centre which specialises in consumer credit law, consumer law and insurance law. She leads a team of 13 lawyers who are dedicated to making life easier for people experiencing vulnerability and disadvantage. Consumer Action strives to create a just marketplace where people have power and businesses play fair. Amanda joined Consumer Action in 2013 and has acted on behalf of experiencing financial hardship clients in a variety of jurisdictions and external dispute resolution forums

Prior to joining CALC, Amanda worked at Piper Alderman Lawyers in the bankruptcy and insolvency team. She was admitted to practice on 17 November 2009. In 2008, Amanda Storey was an Associate to the Honourable Associate Justice Efthim of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

Amanda sits on the Law Council of Australia Consumer Law Commitee and the Law Institute of Victoria Competition and Consumer Law Committee. Amanda Storey was the 2012 President of the Young Lawyers Section of the Law Institute of Victoria where she presided over 7,000 young lawyers. 

Specialties: Consumer litigation, commercial litigation, bankruptcy and insolvency law, advocacy, and volunteer management.

jobs.description: Amanda Storey conducts litigation on behalf of consumers and manages cases across a variety of judicial and EDR forums. Through her litigation and telephone advice work, Amanda identifies policy and systemic consumer issues and uses that information to contribute to the policy, advocacy and campaign activities of the Consumer Action Law Centre.

jobs.jobTitle: President of the Young Lawyers Section
jobs.description:
Amanda Storey was the 2012 elected President of the Young Lawyers Section of the Law Institute of Victoria and presided over 7000 members of the legal profession. In addition to promoting the work of the Young Lawyers Section, she regularly presented at young lawyers events including the annual Orientation for New Lawyers event and the Welcome to the Profession Ceremony at the Supreme Court.

Prior to being the 2012 President of the YLS, she was the 2011 Vice President of the YLS and the co-chair of the YLS Social Committee in 2010.

Amanda Storey worked in the bankruptcy and insolvency dispute resolution team. She assisted with insolvency litigation files in both Federal and Victorian jurisdictions including drafting court documents, appearing in court for ex-parte applications and instructing counsel in more complex opposed hearings. Amanda also drafted deeds of settlement, deeds of forbearance, personal insolvency agreements and detailed letters of advice to clients.

jobs.description: 12 month secondment position

I am a senior solicitor in the Government and Public Law branch of the VGSO and I
      
      practise predominantly in administrative law.
Solicitor in the Litigation and Regulatory team, my focus was on administrative law.

I commenced the Graduate program in February 2013 and completed the Supervised Workplace Training Program.

My first rotation was in the Litigation and Regulatory (Government) team. I assisted the team with advice on regulatory compliance, statutory interpretation and updates on key developments in the law in the areas of privacy and road transport laws. 

I completed my second rotation in the Employment team. I assisted the team with the defence of unfair dismissal claims, drafting of enterprise agreements and advice on general employment and industrial relations matters.

schools.description: The Army Reserve General Service Officer - First Appointment Course (ARes GSO FAC) focuses on instilling the Army’s values of Courage, Initiative and Teamwork. Officer candidates undertake training that is broken up into the following blocks; Military Foundation Skills, Small Military Team Leader Theory, Command/Leadership/Management & All Corps ARes Platoon Commander.These training blocks provide the leadership, management, knowledge and operational skills required of an Officer to command a platoon. During training, candidates are assessed on weapons, fieldcraft, leadership as well as command management and on successful completion receive a Queen's Commission and assume the rank of Lieutenant in the Australian Army.
